text: This song defines, in my humble opinion, the perfect "reaching the final leg of the journey" music. Its calm, almost hypnotically tranquil, with that beat, the "thrum", the strings and woodwinds... then it suddenly picks up into adventuring music again! Its just beautiful. I love you Breath of Fire games, I love you.
author: ChaosSorceror_Davidicus

text: Well said. I feel the same :) I came to say something similar but then read your comment and it sums up my feelings perfectly. I've gone all the way through SupraDarky's Best VGM playlists multiple times and this is one of my personal favorites!
author: Taylor Beck

text: @Taylor Beck The game itself is pretty good too. If you haven't already, give it a try (if you can find it somewhere now). All the Breath of Fires' have had pretty good music in them... except maybe BoF2, the music was a tad too tinny for my tastes, too shrill (whatever they did to Windia was not music).
author: ChaosSorceror_Davidicus

text: No, this is one of those series' that have escaped me. I'd love to check it out one day though. In your opinion, should I begin at BoF1, or start with something a little newer?
author: Taylor Beck

text:
Honestly, they are all fun! BoF 1, 3, and 4 were amazing bloody games. 1 Is a great old-school RPG. BoF3 is my all-time favorite of the 5 games, and has the best story, humor, RPG-elements, music, everything! BoF4 is also a great story, music, and all of that (I just like BoF3 a little better), but where BoF3 has a more japanese feel, BoF4 is decidedly chinese. Give any of them a whirl.

BoF1 - SNES, GBA
BoF2 - SNES, GBA
BoF3 - PS1
BoF4 - PS1
BoF5 - PS2
author: ChaosSorceror_Davidicus

text: @SolstaceWinters Cool man, thanks for the replies :) I'll definitely check one out. Looks like some of em are on or are coming to virtual console, so maybe I'll check it out on there. Or I could hunt down the cartridge and fire up the ol' SNES haha
author: Taylor Beck

text: @Taylor Beck Well I know for a fact that BoF2 is in the Nintendo E-shop. I don't even think they have BoF1, but I could be wrong. The games aren't really canonical so really you can play them in any order you wish. The only real mention of canon is a single line of dialogue in BoF2 related to BoF1. If you can, I'd almost say hunt down BoF3 or 4 because those have probably the greatest plots.
author: ChaosSorceror_Davidicus

text: Yeah, Hitoshi Sakimoto, made FF tactics, Vagrant Story, BOF V, FF XII etc. and recently Dragon's Crown, check out that soundtrack, you'll love it!

text: you're feeling a very positive feeling of hearing a song that you enjoy a lot.  hearing it may have triggered something in your mind to make you think back to something that happened in the past that was really good. we really never forget anything that happens to us or anything that we see or do. it's always there. we just need some help getting the memories back. this song helped to bring a good feeling back to you. you can't remember exactly what it is but it brought it close to you.
